SENT.plain: Our previous reports indicated that Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) contributes to the malignant phenotype and resistance to apoptosis in Burkitt's lymphoma (BL) cell line Akata (N
Here we report that the EBV-encoded small RNAs (EBERs) are responsible for these phenotypes

Transfection of the EBER genes into EBV-negative Akata clones restored the capacity for growth in soft agar, tumorigenicity in SCID mice, resistance to apoptotic inducers, and upregulated expression of bcl-2 oncoprotein that were originally retained in parental EBV-positive Akata cells and lost in EBV-negative subclones
This is the first report which provides evidence that virus-encoded RNAs (EBERs) have oncogenic functions in BL cells
